result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Cornelious Tillman

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Cornelious Tillman in court with attorney Sean Michael Brown.  Defendant Cornelious Tillman in custody.  Thomas Jerome Coaty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Carolyn Kingsley.
State moves to DRI the charges.
BTC: Case DRI.

Defendant Cornelious Tillman in court with attorney Sean Michael Brown.  Defendant Cornelious Tillman in custody.  Sharon Ann Riek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Carolyn Kingsley.
Def is requesting an adjournment of all the matters.
BTC: adjournment granted.  Status conference scheduled for April 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on March 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on March 5, 2015 at 03:15 pm.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  No contact with victim store, Pick and Save,  except for restitution purposes.   It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any  alcohol.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.  The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.   Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Cornelious Tillman in court with attorney Margaret Marie Johnson.  Defendant Cornelious Tillman in custody.  Robin K. Green appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Pat Phinisee.  Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, p-ng, bond set.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 5, 2015 at 03:15 pm.  Status conference scheduled for March 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.
